thread.section_title: Stock Market & Finance News - Wall Street Journal
thread.title: Former Lawmaker Who Was Rejected as Ex-Im Bank Chief to Join SEC

author: Dave Michaels
title: Former Lawmaker Who Was Rejected as Ex-Im Bank Chief to Join SEC
text:
WASHINGTONâ€”Scott Garrett, a former Republican lawmaker known for criticizing what he considered government overreach by Wall Street regulators, has landed a senior role at the Securities and Exchange Commission.
Mr. Garrett, 58 years old, plans to take a position advising SEC Chairman Jay Clayton, according to people familiar with the matter. The job would represent a second act for Mr. Garrett, whom U.S. senators rejected last year as a pick to lead the U.S. Export-Import Bank under the Trump administration.
